activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Colton J. Reinsvold

records.addlTxt:
11:36 AM  22CF92/22CM114 - Defendant Colton J. Reinsvold in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Colton J. Reinsvold.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Erickson states that the preliminary hearing is a go for 22CF92. Attorney Forehand calls Deputy Graham. Sworn and testimony given by Deputy Graham. 
11:55 AM - Crossed by Attorney Erickson. 
11:57 AM - Redirect by Attorney Forehand. 
11:58 AM - Arguments begin. Attorney Forehand asks for bind over. Attorney Erickson objects to bind over.

Court binds over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on November 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Forehand speaks that there will be a public defender but there isn't on today. Court speaks about counsel. Attorney Erickson states that he will be representing CR. 

20CM12 - Judge McDougal recuses due to representing CR.

All other cases will be set for 10/26/22 at 11:15 AM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 11:15 am.

3:39 PM 22CF93/22CM114 - Defendant Colton J. Reinsvold in court, in custody.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Colton J. Reinsvold.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin. Court speaks about the preliminary hearing in 22CF93. 

Attorney Bartelt states that his client would like to remove him from counsel. Court states that this a public defender appointment. Court will approve Attorney Bartelt to withdraw. 
Court asks Attorney Bartelt to file an order for her to sign.

Defendant states that he never asks for the competency exam.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:32 PM 22CF93/22CM114 - Defendant Colton J. Reinsvold appeared by video.  Attorney Amy Elizabeth Forehand in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Colton J. Reinsvold. Attorney Bartelt raise competency. Court orders competency by HHS. Court asks about a probation hold.
Competency hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Competency hearing on September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Forehand appears for the state. CR appears in the Richland County jail. Attorney Forehand asks for a reset; she had received one report but is still missing one. Court reset for 08/01/22 at 3:30 PM
Mr. Reinsvold has called our office and he does qualify for a public defender at this time.  However, we will not have an attorney assigned by the next court date of 7/25@1:00.

1:49 PM Defendant Colton Reinsvold appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Forehand appears in person. Defendant has called the public defenders office.
State asks for $50,000 cash bond
No contact with victims: HR, RR, SS. 
Not to be at the residence of the victims.
Not to possess any dangerous weapons
If release defendant is to be at home at all time except for work, church or school.

CR heard.

Court orders $10,000 Cash bond.
No contact with victims: HR, RR, SS. Not to be at the residence of the victims.
Not to possess any dangerous weapons which includes firearms, knives or anything that can be used as a weapon.
If release: Defendant must be at home at all times except for work, church or school.


Defendant left the zoom hearing at the jail before the next date was given.

Initial appearance set for 07/25/22 at 1 PM.
